items.title: Article
summary_bullets: Myntra promotes employee wellness with engagement spaces like pickleball courts and nap pods.
The company launched Mynverse for tailored learning and development programs.
Diversity initiatives include internships for women and people with disabilities.
Each business unit receives an engagement budget for team dinners and off-sites.

items.title: AT&T CEO: We are not a family. We are a team
summary_bullets: AT&T CEO John Stankey sent a memo emphasizing performance and accountability.
The memo stated, "We are not a family. We are a team."
Flexibility is presented as a privilege earned through performance, not a right.
The memo criticized a 'creeping sense of entitlement' among employees.

items.title: OpenAI's chief people officer Julia Villagra to depart
summary_bullets: OpenAI's Chief People Officer, Julia Villagra, is departing the company.
Villagra joined OpenAI in February 2024 and was promoted to CPO in March.
She is leaving to pursue her passion for using art and music to explain AI.
OpenAI is in an AI talent war, driven by companies such as Meta.

items.title: Apple employees accuse fitness chief Jay Blahnik of workplace harassment
summary_bullets: Apple employees accuse fitness chief Jay Blahnik of workplace harassment.
Accusations include creating a toxic and verbally abusive work environment.
Apple reportedly settled a sexual harassment complaint related to Blahnik.
Internal investigation found no evidence of wrongdoing, and Blahnik remains in his position.

items.title: Coinbase CEO says he fired some employees who didn't adopt AI
summary_bullets: Coinbase CEO fired employees who didn't adopt AI tools after a company-wide mandate.
CEO Brian Armstrong demanded engineers onboard AI tools within a week.
The goal is achieving 50% AI-written code by quarter's end.
Monthly 'AI speed run' training sessions support the AI adoption initiative.

items.title: From grievance to grudge: How unkept promises breed office sadists
summary_bullets: Unkept promises in the workplace can breed 'office sadists'.
Everyday sadism is linked to intrinsic motivation to cope with emotional voids.
Sadists may derive pleasure from the sense of control and power.
Sadistic behavior can manifest as trolling, mocking, gossiping, or dark humor.

items.title: PwC India plans to create 20,000 additional jobs over next five years
summary_bullets: PwC India plans to create 20,000 jobs by 2028.
The company targets threefold revenue growth in five years.
PwC will invest 5% of revenue annually in tech and innovation.
The firm aims for a 50,000-strong workforce.

items.title: How organisations can truly enable people potential
summary_bullets: Psychological safety enables employees to share ideas and learn.
Growth should be a partnership, not just a process.
Align personal ambitions with business needs for mutual growth.
